events.message: The customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred on April 30th, 2024, resulting in damage to the front bumper and hood.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident based on the description of the car collision provided by the customer.
An insurance agent was assigned to the vehicle accident claim to manage communications and next steps with the customer.
The claim from the customer has been formally acknowledged, and they were informed about the processing timeline.
The customer was requested to submit photos of the damaged vehicle and the police report related to the car accident.
The customer uploaded all required documents, including the collision photos and official police report, as requested.
The investigation team commenced a review to assess the damage extent and verify the details submitted in the claim.
The investigation confirmed the validity of the claim and determined the repair costs for the damaged vehicle parts.
A settlement offer was communicated to the customer detailing the compensation amount for the car repair expenses.
The customer confirmed acceptance of the proposed settlement and expressed satisfaction with the handling of the claim.
The claim approval was finalized based on the customer's acceptance of the settlement offer and positive feedback.
The compensation payment for the vehicle repairs was processed and issued to the customer's bank account successfully.
The auto accident claim was closed after the payment was completed and all documents were duly finalized in the system.
The claim file was archived in compliance with company policies for record retention and future reference when necessary.
